pullRequest.title: [ContentEncoding] Add two fields in blob property
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR includes two main updates:

Adding two new fields in blobProperty.
Introduce support in the deserializer.

commit.message: [ContentEncoding] Add two fields in blob property

nodes.bodyText:
I think this null handling case is not actually required, although I see that this pattern was used before in this method.
sb.append("ContentEncoding=").append(null) will work and return "ContentEncoding=null"
For a get blob response, this should be set as the HTTP standard Content-Encoding header instead of x-ambry-content-encoding
In our LinkedIn SecurityService, we use the filename to set the value of the Content-Disposition. Not sure if we want to port that behavior here.
minor: is there a unit test to verify these two properties in BlobIdTransformerTest?
